Option.name: Option
Option.description:
React Option element. Copyright (c) 2016 ItsAsbreuk - http://itsasbreuk.nl
New BSD License - http://choosealicense.com/licenses/bsd-3-clause/

classitems.description: componentDidMount will call `this.activatePlaces()`;
classitems.name: componentDidMount

classitems.description: Returns the index of the first option that is selected
classitems.name: getFirstSelected

return.description: the index (if any) of the first selected option

classitems.description: Sets a new option.
classitems.name: handleSetOption

classitems.description: Sets the focus on the active Element of the Container.
classitems.name: focus

classitems.description: Sets the focus on the specified Element of the Container.
classitems.name: focusOption

params.name: index
params.description: the index of the option to be focussed

classitems.description:
Render-function for the options. You can use this property to override the default
renderer. When not set, the default-renderer will be used.
classitems.name: renderItem

params.name: checked
params.description:
the index of the option to be focussed
return {JSX} li-element for the option

classitems.description: Callback for the keypress event.
classitems.name: handleKeyPress

classitems.description: Tells ifthe Component has a valid option selected.
classitems.name: isValid

return.description: whether the Component has a valid option selected

classitems.description: React render-method --> renderes the Component.
classitems.name: render

classitems.description: Returns a save string
classitems.name: _saveHTML

params.name: String
params.description: html the text that should be removed from any html-entities

classitems.description:
Returns an array based upon `checked`, with the length of `this.props.options`,
where only one item is `true` and the rest will be set `false`. The checked item is the first
item of the `this.props.checked` array.

This will quarantee that there is only 1 option marked as being selected.
Only be needed whenever `this.props.multi`===false.
classitems.name: _toOnlyOne

classitems.description: Whether to autofocus the Component.
classitems.name: autoFocus

classitems.description: A number -or Array with numbers- that define the option that is selected
classitems.name: checked

classitems.description: Whether render the options as HTML. When set `false`, they will be plain text, removed from any html-entities.
classitems.name: dangerousInnerHTML

classitems.description: Whether the focuscontainer is disabled (doesn't response to focusevents and has light-gray options)
classitems.name: disabled

classitems.description:
Render-function for the options. You can use this property to override the default
renderer. When not set, the default-renderer will be used.

This function gets called for every option of the `this.props.options` array.
The function recieves 3 arguments: `option`, `index`, `checked`
Should return a JSX li-element.
classitems.name: ItemRenderer

classitems.description:
What key/keys are responsible for re-focussing `down`. Valid values are charcodes possible prepende with
a special key: 9 or `shift+9` or `ctrl+shift+9`. Multiple key combinations can be defined bydefining an array of keyDown-values.
classitems.name: keyDown

classitems.description:
Whenever `keyEnter` is set, then the focus-container will become a `nested`- focuscontainer.
Nested focuscontainers will automaticcaly become focussable by their parent-container.

The `keyEnter` determines what key/keys are responsible for `entering` this container. Valid values are charcodes possible prepende with
a special key: 39 or `shift+39` or `ctrl+shift+39`. Multiple key combinations can be defined bydefining an array of keyUp-values.
classitems.name: keyEnter

classitems.description:
The `keyLeave` determines what key/keys are responsible for `leaving` this container and go to the parent focus-container.
Valid values are charcodes possible prepende with
a special key: 39 or `shift+39` or `ctrl+shift+39`. Multiple key combinations can be defined bydefining an array of keyUp-values.
classitems.name: keyLeave

classitems.description:
What key/keys are responsible for selecting an option by keyboard. Valid values are charcodes possible prepended with
a special key: 9 or `shift+9` or `ctrl+shift+9`. Multiple key combinations can be defined bydefining an array of keyUp-values.
classitems.name: keyUp

classitems.description:
What key/keys are responsible for re-focussing `up`. Valid values are charcodes possible prepended with
a special key: 9 or `shift+9` or `ctrl+shift+9`. Multiple key combinations can be defined bydefining an array of keyUp-values.
classitems.name: keyUp

classitems.description: Whether the loop the focus when the last/first option is reached.
classitems.name: loop

classitems.description: Whether multiple options can be selected at the same time.
classitems.name: multi

classitems.description:
Callback whenever a new value is set. The callbackFn will recieve 1 argment: the new `checked` option(s).
Which is a `number` in case `props.multi`===fals,e, otherwise it is an array with numbers.
classitems.name: onChange

classitems.description: Callback for when the component did mount.
classitems.name: onMount

classitems.description: List with all options
classitems.name: options

classitems.description: Whether the focuscontainer is readOnly (doesn't response to focusevents)
classitems.name: readOnly

classitems.description: Whether the focussed option should be scrolled into the view when the focusselector focuses it.
classitems.name: scrollIntoView

classitems.description: Selector on which the focusmanager should check against when refocussing
classitems.name: selector

classitems.description: Inline styles for the focus-container
classitems.name: style

classitems.description: The tabIndex
classitems.name: tabIndex

classitems.description: The transition-time when the window needs to be scrolled in order to get the focussable node into the view.
classitems.name: transitionTime
